instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO IMAGE, NO CHIME
threads.message: This board turns on but doesnt do chime or show image... <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> doesnÂ´t come high when display is connected... cpu gets warm and so does the memory chips... is it a dead cpu yet?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO IMAGE, NO CHIME
threads.message:
Any history available?
Did you check for USB activity and external video?
Why the people always go for internal video only???

<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> goes high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO IMAGE, NO CHIME
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is present... no usb activity, no chime or external video

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO IMAGE, NO CHIME
threads.message:
"Any history available?"

Try known good BIOS (already posted on the forum).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO IMAGE, NO CHIME
threads.message:
I think its a dead CPU, in diode mode on L7310/20 I get .009 value, which usually ends being that...
Board was clean, no liquid damage or so...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A NO IMAGE, NO CHIME
threads.message: Diode mode to ground doesn't give a reliable information. Resistance to ground on CPU VCore would be 15-25 ohms for this board, but that just tells you the CPU isn't fully shorted. (can still be dead)
